attributes.action: Allow Chris Brown entry into the U.K.
attributes.background: In 2010, Chris Brown was refused permission to enter the U.K. on the grounds of being guilty of a serious criminal offence. Since then, Chris Brown has paid the price for his earlier mistakes and has shown time and time again that he is a changed man through his actions and his music.
attributes.additional_details: Home office stated in 2010, “public safety is one of our primary concerns”, however, Mr. Brown poses no threat to the general public. Instead he is a source of joy to his fans, especially those in the U.K. who can only experience this vicariously through his social media presence. Therefore we ask that you please sign this petition, so our government can consider a reversal of the refusal of his entry to the U.K.

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Fund more nurses and training for trauma wards in hospitals.
attributes.background: I spent 27 days on trauma ward in hospital. I saw and experienced call bells being ignored, 'red tray' patients not fed as not enough staff and long waits for painkillers. The Government should provide more funding for trauma nurses and better training for staff who work on trauma wards.
attributes.additional_details: Patients (including myself) were left on bed pans/commodes/equipment way longer than necessary and going into emotional breakdown, lashing out at staff. Patients were being referred to as bed numbers. Curtains (for privacy) were being drawn so carelessly that half the ward, including visitors, could see the person using bedpan/having intimate care done. Quiet patients were being ignored and forgotten over demanding ones.

attributes.action: Make dentist check ups and all necessary treatments free on the NHS
attributes.background: If I go to a doctor for a check up or with a problem it doesn't cost me anything. Yet if I go to the dentist I have to pay. If I break my arm or need an operation I don't need to pay for it. If I break my tooth or need something done to my teeth I need to pay.
attributes.additional_details: I work hard and pay my national insurance. I should not need to pay for NHS dentists. If I received certain benefits I could get the dentist for free, but as always regular hard working people of the country who don’t qualify for benefits have to pay for everything. Your teeth are important, it's part of your health and can cause major problems if there is something wrong. Nobody should not need to pay to be seen or treated by a dentist on the NHS!

attributes.action: Give UK armed forces recognition of their service during the cold war
attributes.background: Give UK armed forces personnel the same recognition as the rest of the world has done for their service during the cold war by allowing a medal too be issued.
attributes.additional_details: For all personnel who served past and present.

attributes.action: Include an extra subject in the national curriculum about life skills.
attributes.background: We believe students in UK secondary schools should be given an extra subject including life skills and money management (e.g. how to pay bills, what benefits you’re entitled to, how to register to vote, how to write a CV, etc). This would equip students for adult life after education.

attributes.action: Review eligibility(prior degree) for the Masters loan for the LLM Legal Practice
attributes.background: A long distance Masters degree, which I struggled to pay for in instalments, has now made me ineligible to apply for a Postgraduate loan to study the Legal Practice Course, which I need to become a solicitor. I now face trying to fund this course via expensive loans or not qualifying at all.
attributes.additional_details: Law graduates who struggled to privately fund a Masters as they could not afford the LPC, are not-eligible for the Post graduate loan. The LPC is the main practice course which enables them become Solicitors. The additional LLM on top of the Legal Practice Course(LPC) is an additional dissertation to qualify the LPC for the Masters Loan. I pray that the eligibilty rule which exempts Law graduates with a previous higher qualification from applying for a Masters loan to study the LPC be reviewed.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to abandon an unborn child.
attributes.background: I was abandoned during both my pregnancies by the fathers of my children. It lead to me suffering from depression and difficulties for my children. After rebuilding my life, I wrote a book and started a support group to help other abandoned pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
We want:
 
1) Men who abandon children to be held accountable for their actions.
2) A new criminal offence of abandoning an unborn child.  
3) The government to fund support for women who are going through pregnancy alone.
4) To be heard

attributes.action: Review and amend the Mental Health Act for people on autistic spectrum
attributes.background: The current Mental Health Act makes no allowances for autism and the presentation by people with ASC. This means that a large number of people do not receive vital mental health treatment as they have autism. It needs amending to ensure mental health treatment is available to all.
attributes.additional_details: People on the spectrum present differently to neuro typical people and so do not neatly fit into the narrow boxes proscribed by the Mental Health Act. Allowances and adjustments need to be made so that people with autism are not left unable to access vital mental health services. Please change the act to add criteria that will allow for them to be treated correctly for their condition.

attributes.action: All public institutions must use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients.
attributes.background:
Ethical veganism is not limited to what is eaten, but to everything that is used; it is about minimising harm in all aspects of our lives.
It is reasonable for all public institutions to be mandated to use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients and that are not tested on animals.
attributes.additional_details:
The right to practice your religion and belief is covered under article 9 of the European Convention of Human Rights and the UK's Equality Act.

Under this legislation, the right to hold and practice the view of ethical veganism is recognised. For example: those who are in hospital, school or prison, have the right to request vegan food options. The logic here is the same, we have the right to have vegans options for the washing of our hands.

attributes.action: Fine people for leaving a dog tied up and unattended
attributes.background: Please make it illegal and fine those who leave dogs tied up and unattended.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs who are left outside, tied up, unattended are at risk.
They are more likely to get stolen which is traumatic for the owner and a waste of police resources when so easily avoided. Most of these dogs are not reunited with their families. This should be the responsibility of the owner. Many are not aware dog theft is on the rise in UK by 25% in the last few years.
Additionally the owner may not be aware they made need to clean up after their dog if they have not seen it fouling the pavement.
It can also create issues amongst passing dogs if pavements and paths are blocked by another dog that is restrained. As well as those who are fearful of dogs but have no option to approach if the path is blocked by a dog.

attributes.action: Change the policy on Bereavement Benefit.
attributes.background: I lost my husband some years ago, I have two children with my late husband who are both under the age of 16.  I was receiving bereavement benefit which went towards the support of my children, very much like child maintenance.  I then lost this benefit when I started a new relationship.
attributes.additional_details: This benefit would have been paid till the children were 18, however because I have tried to rebuild my life the benefit stops.  I now have to rely on my new partner to support my children.  My view is why are bereaved parents penalised for moving on in their life, yet had my husband not have died he would be paying me child maintenance roughly the same period of time.  It is not fair that any bereaved parent should be penalised.

attributes.action: The government need to put more money into road signs and cameras
attributes.background: I would like more things put in place to protect people not just on the moterways but on our streets and roads where we live. More money should be put into advanced technology for catching people speeding, like cameras on our roads, because they cost a lot it's very hard to get one on our streets.

attributes.action: Remove the use of 'British Empire' in the UK honours system.
attributes.background:
This petition aims to remove the use of 'British Empire' in UK honorary titles, ending the continuation of colonial language. 

E.g. 'Member of The British Empire' (MBE)
E.g. 'Officer of The British Empire (CBE)

Such awards should be reformed, finally bringing these titles into the modern age.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for secondary schools to isolate pupils
attributes.background: Across England, many secondary schools isolate students for hours, days or weeks at a time, this is only detrimental to a students’ mental health but questionably against the human rights of pupils, this is not a punishment but a custodial sentence in some instances
attributes.additional_details: Schools should not be allowed to isolate pupils for more than one hour, the secondary school I attended (till August 2017) this year would isolate students for something as trivial as a short haircut. Isolation is infringing on the liberties of young people across the country and it should not be tolerated, the problem is more widespread than I thought as many schools across the UK use isolation to reprimand students. Segregation does not breed well rounded individuals.

attributes.action: 2 minute silence for teens lost their lives from knife crime
attributes.background: I would like to have 2minute silence once a year for all the teens who have lost their life to knife crime. The amount of teens loosing their lives is increasing daily. And it makes the news then not mentioned again. I feel each one should be always remembered
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today the total of lives lost to knife crime is 250. Let's keep their memories alive

attributes.action: Make it legal for horses to be ridden on pavements and walkways-safer all round!
attributes.background: Accidents involving horses cause serious injury. There are no clear guidelines for drivers in the highway code.  Most are not aware of horse behaviour and how to pass safely. For everyone's benefit, horses and riders are safer on pavements.

attributes.action: Pass a law to have compulsory clear and concise labelling on ALL food and meds
attributes.background:
Allergies cause deaths and allergic reactions cost the NHS every time someone has to go to A&E.
There is currently a nationwide Adrenalin pen shortage making this cause even more urgent.
ALL Food, toiletries and medications need clear concise labelling for all major allergens.
attributes.additional_details: Anaphylactic shock is terrifying and can result in death. Anyone living with an allergy knows the fear of eating, something that should be sustenance suddenly becomes a deadly game of Russian Roulette. A simple labelling system for all consumables that is industry standard with regard to all ingredients and packaging environments will save lives and remove fear and make providers accountable to do their due diligence as to how their product is produced and ingredients sourced.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to state allergens on product
attributes.background: I recently was hospitlised after an allergic reaction to a moisturiser containing peanut oil. This was not clearly visible on the website or bottle. I want to make it a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to make this clear (emboldened, capitalised) on their products to avoid this happening.
attributes.additional_details: This currently isn’t a legal requirement that companies need to state on products. With the increasing number of nut allergy’s reported each year as well as the number of deaths I think this is extremely important to raise awareness. The NHS reported 4000 new nut allergy’s in 2005 and the number of the diagnosis’ rise each year. It is crucial that more visibility is present in the beauty industry. Some companies name the nuts as clinical terms, making it harder for the sufferer to be aware.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS' National Child Measurement Programme for children in Year 6
attributes.background: Parents are told their child’s overweight if they're on the 91st centile (14% of Yr 6), but many are healthy. In a vulnerable child, this label can lead to eating disorders and THEN they become unhealthy. The scheme isn't working; child obesity at this age has continued to rise since it began.
attributes.additional_details: This NHS scheme hasn't lowered obesity rates, but much needed funding is spent on this ineffective scheme, as well as support for eating disorders that could have been triggered by it. Schools often feed children unhealthy meals but then weigh them and they are are obese. Eating disorders at this age are highly damaging as they delay puberty; children can't develop and grow, and mental well-being is drastically affected. This happened to me 2 years ago, age 11, when I was deemed 'overweight'.

attributes.action: Allow ESA / UC claimants to only go a maximum of 4 weeks without payment.
attributes.background: Employment Support Allowance / Universal credit in many cases is there to provide financial help to those who are unable to work due to physical / mental health conditions. During considerations, assessments and appeals etc. payments can unfortunately be put on hold for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details: The whole process causes a lot of unnecessary stress and financial strain to those affected. The time frame for this should be limited to 4 weeks maximum, as currently in many cases this can be ongoing for months when there is no need for it to take this long.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory GCSE English Literature subject with Computer Science.
attributes.background: An increasing number of jobs require IT and far more than English Literature.

attributes.action: ban the sale of plastic bottle fizzy drinks in the UK
attributes.background: Plastics are one of the biggest problems facing the human race, yet only around 30% of them ever get recycled. Of this 30% they can only be recycled up to 15 times at most before they are not safe to use. If the UK was to stand-up to plastic then that would be a major step towards a cleaner earth.

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts for all 3rd Party Dock Workers and Stevedores.
attributes.background:
The National Dock Labour Board,
set up in 1947, registered all port
workers and guaranteed that dockers
had a basic minimum fallback wage,
whether there was work for them or
not.  In 1989 the Tory Goverment used legislation to remove these rights to fall back pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Ports continue to use 3rd Party Dock Workers through agencies who only provide zero hour contracts.  The ports side step any labour issues by claiming they do not employ these people the agencies do.
Zero hour contracts lead to unsafe practices as training and experience is often lost as these skills are replaced by the untrained and inexperienced staff.   People die in this industry because of this.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal age restriction on the use of smart phones.
attributes.background: I believe that smart phone use is damaging our children. Besides being addicted to them, they may be able to access inappropriate material on line - including sites that promote self-harm and suicide, as well as violence and adult content. This simply has to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
I am all for children having a phone, and believe it is a parent's right to know where their child is and what they are doing. But it should not be a smart phone that has all this freedom to search inappropriate material. 
We protect our children from the dangers of alcohol, tobacco and sexual relationships by having laws that state they must be of a certain age. Surely it makes sense to also protect them from the potential minefield that is the world wide web. This is destroying our children.

attributes.action: Provide more direct investment in nuclear new build projects in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In the last few months, two major developers have pulled out of plans to develop large scale new nuclear in the UK. 

In order to meet future electricity demand and reach climate change targets, no other low carbon technologies are available to replace reliable baseload electricity supply.
attributes.additional_details:
The two suspended projects would have produced 9.2GW of low carbon electricity to the national grid, avoiding millions of tonnes of CO2 emissions each year. At their peaks these projects would have also provided tens of thousands of jobs, a huge boost to the local economy. 

This World Nuclear Association presents the main benefits of nuclear power: http://www.world-nuclear.org/information-library/current-and-future-generation/world-energy-needs-and-nuclear-power.aspx

attributes.action: Test for Category D Should entitle license holder to drive Class 2 ( Vice versa)
attributes.background: I strongly believe (Along with many HGV ancoach drivers) that if you pass the driving test for buses (Category D) this should then entitle the license holder to drive any vehicle up to 7500 kg.
attributes.additional_details: On a category D licences you can drive an 18000kg Tri Axle coach but not a 7500kg truck. Although the coach may be longer and taller. This doesn’t make any sense. I also believe that with Category D on your license, you should be able to tow any trailer on your car when over the age of 25.

attributes.action: Appoint a Minister for Men and Equalities to address issues facing men and boys.
attributes.background:
Over the last couple of years there has been a lot of focus on issues affecting women and girls. This is good because when issues are openly discussed attitudes can be changed and solutions found.
There are also many issues facing men and boys which do not often receive the attention they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Compared to women, men are:

Over three times more likely to take their own lives
Over six times more likely to be sleeping rough
Three times more likely to be homeless

Too many young men and boys are losing their lives to knife crime.

There is a lack of male primary school teachers to act as positive role models for boys - one in four primaries has not a single male teacher. 

A screening programme for prostate cancer is long overdue.

The government’s current approach to all this is failing.

attributes.action: Improve treatment and support for patients with small cell lung cancer
attributes.background: Small cell lung cancer is an underfunded type of cancer in the UK. It takes many lives due to its aggressive nature of metastasising rapidly. I want the government to consider improving treatment options and support to improve life expectancy for patients with this condition.

attributes.action: End Austerity and increase funding to NHS, Schools & Housing Authority
attributes.background: NHS workers have been overworked. They are tired, depressed, and most of all exhausted. NHS funding, quite simply, is totally inadequate. The same can be said about our Schools. Homelessness is the highest it has ever been.

attributes.action: Allow same sex male couple to have IVF on the NHS just like everyone else
attributes.background: Under the NHS a straight couple, lesbian couple and other couples are allowed to have IVF paid for by the NHS but a gay male couple isn’t allowed to have IVF funded for by the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Me and my husband have been wanting to do IVF but we would have to pay over £5000 to have a child. 
But if we where single or in a straight/lesbian relationship we cannot get any help from the NHS. Please help change this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Parliament Must reject the EU withdrawal agreement that is on the table.
attributes.background: This agreement is not fit for purpose it gives the EU everything they want but the UK must wait to see what it gets, and there is no way out.

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Refer to disability as a “different ability” on official publications and in law
attributes.background: I do not believe that all “disabilities” put people at a disadvantage as implied by the term dis-ability. I believe this reference drives a thinking and culture that is not inclusive and supportive of many peoples varying abilities. I believe all references should refer to different abilities.
attributes.additional_details:
I was diagnosed with a form of learning “disability” in high school. From my perspective this ability has never been a detriment to me in fact in many ways it has been a strength as I learn very visually and so I am able to create simple views of complex information. 
 
However the cultural reference of a disability drives a lack of acceptance within the work place and society. 
 
Do you have a different ability and would like it recognised as such?
 
Small words have big affects.

attributes.action: Amend the Sexual Offence Act 2003 to include female rape
attributes.background: The current Sexual Offences Act 2003 is gender-bias as the law only legally recognises sexual offences committed by males as rape. This neglects those (males and females) who have been have been sexually assaulted by females.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose the following changes to the legislation 
 
Rape 
1) A person (A) commits an offence if— 
(a) A intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with any part of person's (A) body, 
(b) A intentionally penetrates their own vagina, anus or mouth with another person’s (B) body, 
(c) B does not consent to the penetration, and 
(d)A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

attributes.action: Require drivers to pass the UK driving test to be able to drive in the UK
attributes.background: The reason I believe that drivers from overseas should take the UK driving test is because there are too many accidents on the UK roads caused by drivers from overseas because the roads in the UK are different to many other countries.

attributes.action: Keep grants for plug-in hybrid & electric cars at their current levels or above
attributes.background: Sales of electric cars are starting to take off, but government action could stop it in its tracks. From 12 November onwards, the government will drop cash incentives even for the greenest plug-in hybrid cars. More seriously, the discount on full-electric vehicles will be cut from £4500 to £3500.
attributes.additional_details:
This action suggests the government doesn't care about the environment or encouraging adoption of low- and zero-emission vehicles. 

Nicholas Lyes from the RAC said the move was “a major blow to anyone hoping to go green with their next vehicle”. 

The AA's Jack Cousens: "This announcement will simply put more drivers off from buying greener cars."

More information 
Autocar -- https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/mitsubishi-extremely-disappointed-end-government-plug-car-grants

BBC -- https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45831150

Original announcement:
Gov.uk -- https://www.gov.uk/government/news/reformed-plug-in-car-grant-extended-into-next-decade

attributes.action: I want the government to allow yearly smear tests for all women.
attributes.background: Women in the UK are told to wait every 3 years for a smear test and it is too long. In the past 5 years, I have had two abnormal smear tests and I have paid to go privately every year because I am too scared to wait 3 years. Two other members of my family have had the same issue. We need change!

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: I believe that, unless there is a ‘baby changing room’ already allocated, there should be changing facilities in all female AND male bathrooms.
attributes.additional_details: I am tired of visiting family restaurants and being the only adult able to change our baby! I am yet to see baby changing facilities in male bathrooms and it makes life for my husband difficult and especially restricting when he is alone with the children. I also wonder how it must make male, same sex couples feel as parents when neither can visit the ladies bathroom.

attributes.action: Reduce child support/child maintenance service rates
attributes.background: People can suffer financial hardships due to overwhelming rates of CSA or CMS and are unable to move on in life. Both parties should be able to move on from divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
Child benefit is capped weekly at £20.70 for the first child, £17 approx for 2nd child. This should be the basis for CSA/CMS too.
In some cases, there can currently be in excess of £400 monthly for two children compared to £148 approx monthly the government pay a family child benefit for two children. People can be forced into poverty or hardship through CSA or CMS due to the impossibility of living off what they have left.

attributes.action: Let's get Thornton back on track - Reinstatement of the rail link.
attributes.background: The rail link from Poulton Le Fylde to Fleetwood via Thornton closed to to passengers in 1970 and to freight in 1999. The effect on our transport infrastructure and on jobs has been devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we want this?
1. To better connect Thornton Cleveleys to Poulton and Fleetwood (via rail and / or tram)
2. To battle the traffic congestion on our roads
3. To bring greater employment opportunities and economic prosperity to the area

attributes.action: Ban websites supporting and promoting eating disorders, suicide and self harm
attributes.background:
The internet these days are widely accessed by all ages. This allows vulnerable and young people to access harmful content promoting and sharing ideas towards eating disorders, self harm and suicide. 
We would like the government to impose a ban on accessing such sites in the UK
attributes.additional_details: https://www.healthyplace.com/abuse/self-injury/why-pro-self-injury-pro-self-harm-websites-are-dangerous

attributes.action: Ban Fireworks that are toxic to both the environment and humans!
attributes.background: To produce the oxygen needed for fireworks, many fireworks contain oxidisers known as perchlorates. These can dissolve in water, contaminating rivers, lakes and drinking water.
attributes.additional_details: "Fireworks get their flamboyance from a variety of chemicals, many of which are toxic to humans. From the gunpowder that fuels their flight to the metallic compounds that colour their explosions, fireworks often contain carcinogenic or hormone-disrupting substances that can seep into soil and water, not to mention the lung-clogging smoke they release and plastic debris they scatter."

attributes.action: Change the current process when bringing complaints to the IOPC
attributes.background: The IOPC (formerly the IPCC) is responsible for overseeing complaints made against police forces in England and Wales. However, the current procedure allows Chief Constables to circumnavigate the IOPC and investigate complaints themselves. We want this changed to make the IOPC truly independent.
attributes.additional_details: When a complaint is made to the IOPC the current procedure is that it is sent to the Chief Constable of the force being complained about. It is then the decision of that Chief Constable whether he/she will investigate or hand it back to the IOPC. This current system is not independent or fair and means that in many cases the complainant is prevented by the police from being heard by anyone impartial unless they apply for a Judicial Review afterwards, which is beyond the financial means of most.

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Make tobacco smoking banned in all public places
attributes.background: In a global environment increasingly polluted by emissions from motor vehicles and the air quality, especially in inner city urban environments becoming ever poorer, why do non-smokers have to put up with the disgusting habit of smoking in public places?

attributes.action: Apologise for the 46,000 concentration camp civilian deaths in the Boer War
attributes.background: During the Boer War (South African War 1899-1902) 46,000 South African civilians died in concentration camps. This matter has recently been trivialised by a British politician and needs careful examination and an acknowledgement of culpability and an apology by the British Government.

attributes.action: Ban advertising of products which are irresponsible on the climate such as SUVs.
attributes.background: We are facing a climate crisis and mass extinctions. We are at risk as a species yet we still are bombarded with adverts promoting highly irresponsible products - unnecessary flights, gas-guzzling cars, cruises.
attributes.additional_details: Like smoking, sugar, salt, and alcohol it is time to step up and act to reduce consumer demand. Limiting advertising is one way to do this which has been successful in multiple circumstances.

attributes.action: Reduce vat on head lice treatment
attributes.background: Since the demise of the "nit nurse" in schools in the 1990's and the withdrawal of free NHS prescription for treatment's in 2018. Head lice are becoming more prevalent. Parents need some support, reducing expences would mean more parents could afford to treat successfully
attributes.additional_details:
Schools offer no advice or support to parents.

Doctors no longer prescribe on the NHS

Head Lice can cause stress  anxiety,loss of sleep and bullying. 

It is an unpleasant infection.

attributes.action: Make light reflectors mandatory for childrens prams & strollers
attributes.background: The law regarding light reflectors on prams/strollers in the U.K needs to change. Prams/strollers are currently not required by law to have any reflector of any kind, with priority given to style & the safely of the actual pram.
attributes.additional_details:
The pram will always be in front of the adult when being pushed. Crossing the road can be a hazard that cars may not see - with special consideration to darker prams, when a crossing is not available & along country roads.
 
Having reflectors will enable vehicle drivers to see the hazard a few crucial seconds before they would have without the reflectors.
